item.title: Sondra add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Sondra add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Siddhārtha Gautama
item.description: "You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection" -- Siddhārtha Gautama

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Love truth, but pardon error." -- Voltaire

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "Silence is sometimes the best answer" -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "For myself I am an optimist - it does not seem to be much use to be anything else." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Sondra add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Joseph Joubert
item.description: "The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones." -- Joseph Joubert

item.title: Sondra add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one." -- George Washington

item.title: Sondra add a quote by George Washington Carver
item.description: "How far you go in life depends on your being tender with the young, compassionate with the aged, sympathetic with the striving and tolerant of the weak and strong. Because someday in your life you will have been all of these. " -- George Washington Carver

item.title: Sondra add a quote by James Truslow Adams
item.description: "There are obviously two educations. One should teach us how to make a living and the other how to live. Surely these should never be confused in the mind of any man who has the slightest inkling of what culture is. For most of us it is essential that we should make a living...In the complications of modern life and with our increased accumulation of knowledge, it doubtless helps greatly to compress some years of experience into far fewer years by studying for a particular trade or profession in an institution; but that fact should not blind us to another—namely, that in so doing we are learning a trade or a profession, but are not getting a liberal education as human beings." -- James Truslow Adams

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Peter Stone
item.description: "In my many years I have come to a conclusion that one useless man is a shame, two is a law firm, and three or more is a congress." -- Peter Stone

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I always deserve the best treatment because I never put up with any other." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What are men to rocks and mountains?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sondra add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson
